info.title: HQ Master Data API
info.description: API for querying the HQ canonical leads database

get.description: Get leads with optional filters.

parameters.name: business_model

schema.description: Filter by business model: B2B, B2C, or Both
schema.title: Business Model

parameters.description: Filter by business model: B2B, B2C, or Both

get.description:
Fast leads endpoint for demos - skips the expensive count query.
Returns up to `limit` results quickly without pagination metadata.

parameters.name: business_model

schema.description: Filter by business model: B2B, B2C, or Both
schema.title: Business Model

parameters.description: Filter by business model: B2B, B2C, or Both

get.description:
Get count of people who previously worked at a specific company.
Optionally filter by Sales Nav job function and/or person's country.
Job function accepts Sales Nav values which map to our internal functions.

parameters.name: job_function

schema.description: Filter by Sales Nav job function (e.g., 'Engineering', 'Customer Success and Support')
schema.title: Job Function

parameters.description: Filter by Sales Nav job function (e.g., 'Engineering', 'Customer Success and Support')

get.description:
Get a preview of leads who previously worked at a specific company.
Returns their current job info. Optionally filter by Sales Nav job function and/or country.

parameters.name: job_function

schema.description: Filter by Sales Nav job function (e.g., 'Engineering', 'Customer Success and Support')
schema.title: Job Function

parameters.description: Filter by Sales Nav job function (e.g., 'Engineering', 'Customer Success and Support')

get.description:
Get breakdown of people who previously worked at a company, grouped by Sales Nav job function.
Uses mapping table to translate our job functions to Sales Nav equivalents.
Get all priority companies with their alumni counts.

post.description: Add a company to the priority list.

delete.description: Remove a company from the priority list.

get.description: Get leads who were recently promoted.
Get leads who recently started a new role.
Get leads at VC portfolio companies.

Get leads who previously worked at specified companies.

Uses PostgreSQL function core.get_leads_by_past_employer() for efficient querying.

Get leads who previously worked at customers of the specified company.

Looks up the company's customers from core.company_customers, then finds
leads who have work history at those customer companies.

Get all filter options from reference tables.

This is the canonical source of truth for frontend dropdowns.
All values come from reference tables, not from querying data.
Get seniority levels from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Seniorities Api Filters Seniorities Get

get.description: Get job functions from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Job Functions Api Filters Job Functions Get

get.description: Get employee ranges from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Employee Ranges Api Filters Employee Ranges Get

get.description: Get industries from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Industries Api Filters Industries Get

get.description: Get signals from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Signals Api Filters Signals Get

get.description: Get business models from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Business Models Api Filters Business Models Get

get.description: Get countries from reference table.

schema.title: Response Get Countries Api Filters Countries Get

get.description:
Get tech stack technologies from reference table.
Used for autocomplete in the Technologies filter.

Get normalized job titles from reference table.
Used for autocomplete in the Hiring For filter.

post.description:
Create or update a target client view.

If a view for this domain already exists, it will be updated.
Returns the view with its shareable URL.

get.description:
Get a target client view by its slug.

Frontend uses this to load the saved filters when client visits their URL.

delete.description: Delete a target client view by its slug.

get.description:
Validate a session token.

Pass token in Authorization header: "Bearer <token>"
Returns whether session is valid and user_id if so.

Get the current user and their org from session token.

Pass token in Authorization header: "Bearer <token>"
Returns user details, org, and role.
List all organizations (admin endpoint).

schema.title: Response List Orgs Api Auth Orgs Get

get.description: Get an organization by slug.

post.description:
Send a magic link to the user's email.

Checks if the email domain is approved before sending.

get.description:
Verify a magic link token and create a session.

Creates user and org if they don't exist.
Get companies with optional filters.
Search companies by name or domain for autocomplete.

Lookup company domain by name.
Returns the best matching domain for a given company name.

Get insights about a company's customers:
- Industries of customer companies
- Job titles of people featured in case studies/testimonials

Simple check: does this company have customer data?
Returns: { "has_customers": true/false, "count": N }

Check if case study details have been extracted for this company.
Returns: { "has_case_studies": true/false, "count": N, "last_extracted_at": timestamp }

Get customer companies for a given company domain.
Returns enriched customer data including name, domain, industry, employee range, and country.

Get ICP criteria and data for a company.
Returns industries, job titles, countries, employee ranges, value proposition, and customer domains.

Get similar companies for a domain.

First checks the database cache. If no data exists (or refresh=True),
calls the Modal function to fetch from companyenrich.com API.

parameters.name: refresh

schema.description: Force refresh from API even if cached
schema.title: Refresh

parameters.description: Force refresh from API even if cached

get.description:
Get companies using a specific technology.
Searches the PredictLeads tech stack data.

Get companies hiring for a specific job title.
Searches the job postings data by normalized_title.
Get companies running Google ads.
Get companies running LinkedIn ads.
Get companies running Meta (Facebook/Instagram) ads.

Get all ad platform data for a specific company.
Returns Google, LinkedIn, and Meta ad status and counts.
Get a single company by domain with full details.

Get all enrichment workflows from the registry.

Use coalesces_to_core=true to see workflows that write to core tables.
Use coalesces_to_core=false to see workflows that only write to raw/extracted.
Use usage_category=client to see client-facing workflows (signals).
Use usage_category=internal-hq to see internal HQ workflows.
Use has_api_wrapper=true to see only workflows with /run/* API endpoints.

parameters.name: entity_type

schema.description: Filter by entity type: company, person, target_client
schema.title: Entity Type

parameters.description: Filter by entity type: company, person, target_client

parameters.name: coalesces_to_core

schema.description: Filter by whether data flows to core schema
schema.title: Coalesces To Core

parameters.description: Filter by whether data flows to core schema

parameters.name: payload_type

schema.description: Filter by payload type: enrichment, inference, signal, etc.
schema.title: Payload Type

parameters.description: Filter by payload type: enrichment, inference, signal, etc.

parameters.name: usage_category

schema.description: Filter by usage category: client, internal-hq
schema.title: Usage Category

parameters.description: Filter by usage category: client, internal-hq

parameters.name: workflow_type

schema.description: Filter by workflow type: ingest, calls_ai, lookup, utility, backfill
schema.title: Workflow Type

parameters.description: Filter by workflow type: ingest, calls_ai, lookup, utility, backfill

parameters.name: has_api_wrapper

schema.description: Filter by whether workflow has an API wrapper endpoint
schema.title: Has Api Wrapper

parameters.description: Filter by whether workflow has an API wrapper endpoint

get.description: Get a summary of workflow counts by entity type, core status, and usage category.

Get domains that have customer data but no similar companies data.
These are candidates for enrichment.

post.description:
Process pending domains for similar companies enrichment.

Queries pending domains directly, inserts into queue, triggers processing.
Frontend just specifies batch_size - no need to send domains.

get.description: Get status of a similar companies batch.

delete.description:
Clear items from the queue.
By default leaves 'processing' items alone.
Set include_processing=true to clear stuck processing items too.

get.description: Get overall queue status - pending, processing, done, error counts.

post.description:
Ingest BuiltWith tech stack data for a domain.

Flow:
1. Store raw payload → raw.builtwith_payloads
2. Extract each tech → extracted.company_builtwith
3. Auto-populate → reference.technologies (ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING)
4. Map to core → core.company_technologies

get.description: Get people with optional filters.

post.description:
Get a person's full work history from enrichment data.
Returns all past and current positions.

Quick check if a person has been enriched (has work history data).
Returns enrichment status and the date of last insert.

This endpoint must be defined LAST so specific routes take precedence.

post.description: Ingests lead data into client.leads, client.leads_people, and client.leads_companies

post.description: Uploads a video recording of LinkedIn job search results, extracts frames, and uses GPT-4o vision to extract job postings

post.summary: Send SalesNav export file to Clay webhook
post.description: Parses a TSV/CSV file and sends each row to Clay webhook in background at 10 records/second. Returns immediately.

post.summary: Send unsent case study URLs to Clay webhook (via Modal)
post.description: Proxies to Modal function that sends URLs at 10 records/second and marks each as sent_to_clay.

post.summary: Send client leads to Clay webhook
post.description: Sends all leads for a client_domain to Clay at ~10 records/second.

post.summary: Resolve customer company domain using Gemini
Send unresolved customer names to Clay webhook (via Modal)
post.description: Proxies to Modal function that sends customers without domains at 10 records/second.
